text: If you are having issues

with your Facebook
account and need support,
try these options to get help.

First off, calling any
of the Facebook numbers
won't get you any support.
You'll get a recorded message
directing you to reach them via email
or through help pages online.

We'll provide the numbers
in the description below.
You can try these phone numbers

to find out where to
send your email requests.

To access Facebook's
help and support section
through the Facebook website,

you'll need to be logged
in to your account.
After you log in,
click on the small drop-down arrow here.
Then click on "Help & Support."
From here, you can report a problem,
view your support inbox,
or access the help center.

The report a problem link
gives you the ability
to provide feedback to Facebook
about any of its features

or to inform them of a
technical glitch or problem.
Click on either one to fill out a form
to send to Facebook about your issue.

The support inbox is where
you will find responses

to reports you have made
about other Facebook users
or information about your own violations.

The help center link takes you
to a library of information
about a wider range of topics and issues.
Here, you'll find a menu of main topics
in a list on the left

and a grid of icons with popular
topics in the main window.

You can also use the search
bar at the top of the screen.
Enter your question and press return.

You'll be presented
with a list of articles
that are related to your query.
